etymology.description: 點(點) (diǎn, "dot; point; select") refers to the act of skillfully adding or preparing something, and 茶(茶) (chá, "tea") signifies the beverage itself. 點(點) (diǎn, "dot; point; select") in this context implies the process of carefully preparing or presenting the tea during the whisking method.
etymology.interpretation: 點茶(點茶) (diǎn chá, "traditional tea whisking method") is a traditional Chinese practice where tea powder is whisked together with hot water to create a frothy mixture. This method was popularized during the Song dynasty, emphasizing the appreciation and artistry involved in tea preparation, symbolizing cultural refinement.
